title: Lancaster City Council: £141 Million Under the Microscope
summary: Lancaster City Council has spent £141 million across 24,593 transactions with 1,785 suppliers since 2021. Our AI analysis reveals where every pound goes — from Preston City Council receiving £7.5M to the Eden Project Morecambe's £3.5M allocation.
author: Lancaster Council Transparency

title: Lancaster's £596K Duplicate Payment Problem
summary: Our analysis flagged £596,000 in likely duplicate payments to Lancaster City Council suppliers — 26 high-confidence groups where identical amounts were paid to the same supplier on the same day three or more times.
author: Lancaster Council Transparency

title: Eden Project Morecambe: £3.5 Million and Counting
summary: Eden Project Morecambe Ltd has received £3.5 million from Lancaster City Council, making it the fifth-largest supplier. With the project still under construction, what does this spending represent?
author: Lancaster Council Transparency

title: Lancaster Procurement: Low Concentration, Strong Competition
summary: Lancaster has the most competitive supplier base in Lancashire with an HHI of just 118 — the lowest concentration score of all eight councils we track. Here's what that means for value for money.
author: Lancaster Council Transparency

title: How Lancaster Compares: Cross-Council Spending Analysis
summary: With a population of 144,246, Lancaster is the largest council we cover. At £245 per head annually, it sits in the middle of Lancashire's spending range — but its service expenditure profile tells a different story.
author: Lancaster Council Transparency
